dialogues.text: For god's sake, I didn't break both hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeez, I still can't believe you broke your hand on her face? It's so Linda Hamilton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slugging some wine) I hope she enjoys shitting out the teeth she swallowed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: The store's owner, CARLOS, 50, picking up the RINGING PHONE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: R osa Angelica, this is Carlos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Carlos, it's Diane Tannen calling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, sГ­, Senora Tannen, como esta?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (annoyed) Uh, Carlos...english, comprende?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taken aback) Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to need a delivery to the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A "MOONWALK" INFLATABLE CARNIVAL RIDE is being inflated o the front lawn by a WORKER, as TWO JUGGLERS warm up next it, tossing clubs between them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phase two: wild shopping sprees carried out in a euphoric state.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FIVE DELIVERY VANS from Rosa Angelica are parked outside FIVE DELIVERY BOYS unload their cargo. It appears that th have brought the entire inventory of Rosa Angelica. DOZEN BOUQUETS and ARRANGEMENTS line the driveway. Mini stands outside next to Carlos, sucking on a lollipop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gosh, look at all the pretty flowers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your mother said you are having a big party!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (innocently) I know, can you believe all this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then, Diane's Jaguar pulls into the driveway. She lo at the trucks, her expression souring. She stops the car flies out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carlos, what the hell is going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Senora Tannen, the delivery you ordered yesterday for the party?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ordered, I didn't order anything?! Who told you to bring these here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (flustered) But, but, Senora, you did, you called me, I talked to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you didn't!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SГ­, you said you were having a party, don't you remember?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: You were very excited, saying you were going to have the most wonderful party and invite everyone you knew and it had to be just perfect. Perfect, that's what you said.     M

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom, is that what you were talking about yesterday?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it was after lunch and you had washed your pain killers down with some wine. You mumbled something about a party before you took a nap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I did not!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wincing) Mom, you did. The doctor said no more mixing pain killers and alcohol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, but...I only slept for--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Carlos) I am so sorry. Listen, we'll pay, don't worry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mini leads Carlos back to his vans, just Martin's Mercede pulls up. Diane turns around to see his car and a look of dread strikes her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, god.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right on cue. Let's see how convincing he is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin gets out of the car, surveying the damage. A look pure indignant outrage overcomes him and it's impossible tell this is an act.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is going on?! Carlos, what the fuck are all these flowers doing here?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oooh, now I see why he makes the big bucks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SeГ±or Tannen, we--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, Martin, I, I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diane, did you order all this?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom, go inside, just go, I'll handle him. (trying to calm him) It's under control, Dad. Please, let's not make a scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -Mini opens the front door to find A DELIVERY VAN from WATERFORD CRYSTAL pull up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over the next few days, whenever Mom had passed out from too much drinky-drinky...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -The door opens again as A FURRIER holding a full length coat stands before her with a big smile on his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd pull out her wallet...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -A SALESMAN dangling the keys to a FORD MUSTANG CONVERTIB which is parked behind him in the driveway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and reach out and touch someone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -A FLATBED TRUCK hauling a 30 FOOT SAILBOAT behind it pul up in front of the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's really remarkable what you can order with a Platinum card these days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A strung out Diane sits on the couch, smoking and nursing Vodka tonic. THE DOORBELL rings and Diane reacts like a d in a thunderstorm, a jolt of fear coursing through her bo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talk about easy. After a week of my version of the home shopping network, the doorbell might as well have been a canon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diane gets up and walks unsteadily towards the front door

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mini and Kayla sit in a history class, looking dreamily a their teacher, WARREN BISHOP, 25, an earnest young preppy the middle of a lecture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At this point, dear old mummy was so spooked, I was actually afraid she might stop drinking. So I needed a back up plan, to keep her...off-balance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As we see from a closer examination of the facts, Abraham Lincoln's decision to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bishop's voice fades out as he continues to speak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, here's someone I'd like to make sit, roll over and then toss me his snausage. But today... priorities are priorities.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mini raises her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Bishop, can I go to the little girls room?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course, Mini.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mini walks down the empty corridor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SCHOOL NURSE, HELGA HAUPTFГњHRER, 55 and very Aryan, enters the empty bathroom and walks into a stall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The school nurse, a regimented Kraut lush named Helga HauptfГјhrer, or "der FГјhrer" as she was affectionately known, starts jonesing for her afternoon nip...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HauptfГјhrer sits down and takes a bottle of vodka out of nurses coat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...exactly 45 minutes after lunch each day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes a long slug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mini quickly picks the flimsy lock on the medicine cabine with a paper clip. She quickly looks through the bottles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which leaves me free to help myself to the candy store.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mini finds what she needs and holds it up to read the lab

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: THE LABEL indicating "RITALIN" and the dosage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mini quickly closes the cabinet, walks out and stuffs the bottle in her pocket, just before HauptfГјhrer enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank god for the quack who invented ADD and the lazy parents willing to let "Der FГјhrer" keep their kids comfortably numb on what basically amounts to legalized speed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mini stands at the counter, making her mom A MARGARITA. S cutting up all kinds of tropical fruits and putting them a blender.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My fears of mom giving up the sauce were unfounded. Actually, she started drinking more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She then takes a few tablets of Ritalin and grinds them u with their coffee grinder. She pours that into the blende and puts the lid on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which gave me the perfect opportunity to prescribe her a little pick-me-up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns on the blender.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diane's getting dressed for a party, trying to gracefully camouflage her cast with jewelry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (annoyed) Mini! I asked you for that drink ten minutes ago!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mini walks in, carrying the margarita.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put it on the counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're welcome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diane takes a pain killer and washes it down with the margarita.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmm...this is really good. What's in it, Sweetie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The first time in my life she calls me "sweetie" and I've just slipped her the mother of all Mickeys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, this and that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The party is chock full of TROPHY WIVES and their decided less attractive HUSBANDS. Diane is in a full blown booze Ritalin induced monologue, having cornered TWO WOMEN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My god, let me tell you, breaking my hand on that bitch's face...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two women recoil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...was the best thing that ever happened to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phase three: rambling incoherent monologues in public.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel fantastic, just fabulous. I mean, I feel like I could run a marathon like that Bruce Jenner guy. He did that, right? Boy, I'll tell you before he had that face lift that made him look like a drag queen, I would've let him stick his javelin in me any day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, her ears unconsciously pick up the strands of a conversation going on behind them between TWO HUSBANDS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I looked each and every juror in the eye-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (spinning around) I want to talk to you about juries, will you come and talk to me about juries?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to be on a jury and say "guilty!" or "sidebar!" What do you think goes on in all the sequestered situations? Do you think any of the jurors have sex with each other? I was once on an episode of Love Boat, playing the role of "Bikini Girl" and my line was "I'll have another," it was with "Isaac" at the pool bar. I had to suck one of the associate producers off to get the line, but it got me my SAG card, so I guess it was worth it.

dialogues.speaker: T
dialogues.text: he men shoot each other an uncomfortable glance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, I think I could use a refill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me too, (to Diane) please, excuse us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They head towards the bar and Diane follows. The two wome she turned away from shake their heads at the spectacle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, but we were talking about juries and Isaac and, and that drag queen I broke my face on and..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two men try to ignore her, but she keeps following th She finally realizes they aren't stopping. She grabs the first man by the shoulder, pissed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! COCKBREATH!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The party stops. Everyone is staring at Diane as the musi continues to play. She looks around the room at the disapproving eyes, panic setting in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diane is led away by Martin and Mini, as other partygoers watch the sad scene. They both struggle to keep Diane fro stumbling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slurring) ...And then I told him that I had been an extra on Hello Larry and Mike Farrell had tried to--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MacLean Stevenson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MacLean Stevenson played "Larry."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right, that's what I said...and then MacKenzie Phillips tried to slip me the tongue!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diane lies passed out on the bed as Mini and Martin watch sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, great job, but you need to give me more warning. I was at dinner with Chapman, and it's the second time I've had to re- schedule.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, but it was a golden opportunity. You always said you can't pay enough for good publicity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mini and Martin peruse the aisles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At this point, with all those witnesses, Martin thought we could get a shrink to have her sent away.

dialogues.speaker: T
dialogues.text: hey stop in front of a wall of tools: hand axes, hammers saws. Mini selects a large hand axe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My feeling was that until they were ready to weld the door to her padded cell shut...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mini picking out two black ski masks, two pairs of black goggles and two black sweatsuits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...there was more work to be done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diane walks through the mall aimlessly. She wears a wrink mis-buttoned pink blouse. Her eyes are hollow, her cheeks sunken. A few SHOPPERS throw her a concerned glance as th pass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Final phase: Complete psychotic breakdown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MINI, disguised in a hat and sunglasses, leans on the rai from the next level up, watching her mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mini slides into a table next to TWO SKATEPUNKS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, boys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two guys exchange a glance. Cute girls like Mini clea don't "hey, boys" them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wanna have a little fun?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diane looks at some clothes. RING! Her cell phone goes of and she answers it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (breathy, threatening) Diane?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The breathing increases, getting deeper and more menacing

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?...What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can see you? Can you see me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (alarmed) Who is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you feel safe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking around) Who is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't answer the question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mini and the two skatepunks giggle with glee at the terro they're inflicting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks around, scanning THE MALL. Nothing seems out of ordinary.            D

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't funny. I'm hanging up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If this is some kind of joke...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I assure you, I'm no joke. May I say that pink blouse is very fetching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Panicked, she heads for an exit. A FEW SHOPPERS look at h with concern.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diane, your car is the other way. (menacing) Now answer my question. Do you feel safe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A whimper escapes from her throat as she looks around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm hanging up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very calm) Hang up and you're dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (falling apart) Why are you doing this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you see me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She scans the crowd frantically, then starts walking towa a VICTORIA'S SECRET STORE for help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pick me out something sexy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave me alone!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very calm) But I'm so close to you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stops, frozen in fear. Just then, the second SKATEPUN comes up behind her, brushing into her. She jerks away fr him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screeching) Get away!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EVERY SHOPPER within ear shot turns around, including TWO SECURITY GUARDS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take it easy, lady, what the hell's your problem?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The skatepunk walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MINI and THE FIRST SKATEPUNK watch with amusement from an upper level as A SECURITY GUARD moves towards her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peek a boo...I'm coming for you...but that guard can't help you. Maybe you should make a run for that Gold Jag you drive home to Mira Loma Lane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whimpering) How do you know where I live?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know everything about you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maam?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diane spins around to find TWO SECURITY GUARDS standing behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to have to ask you to leave the mall. We'll wal you to your car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! I can't leave, he knows where I live!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maam, you're going to have to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you hear me?! He knows where I live!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who knows?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hands him the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The security guard puts the phone to his ear. The BEEPING sound of a hang up is heard. He nods to his partner, as h removes a walkie talkie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into walkie talkie) Yeah, this is Franklin, we've got a code 7, get an EMS unit over here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two guards grab her. She drops the phone and starts scratching at one guard's face. The other pepper sprays h as she falls down, howling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, Maam, this is for your own protection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RING! The phone is like a jolt of electricity through her body. Diane kicks and punches at the guards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's him! Answer it! Answer it! He said he was gonna kill me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guards finally tackle her, getting handcuffs on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He, he knows where I live!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE OTHER SHOPPERS watch for a moment and lose interest, writing her off as just another LA kook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MINI watches from the upper level, quite satisfied.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diane lies in bed, half awake, watching TV. A scotch and rests in her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After her performance at the mall, I'm sure she would have qualified as "committable". But that wasn't enough, I wanted her to beg the boys in the white coats to take her away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mini pokes her head in the door of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom, we're going to get some dinner. Do you want us to bring you back something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're leaving? Both of you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For the last three days she hasn't left the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't we just order in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom, we can't stay in here forever. Do you want to come with us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diane considers the question by looking at her face in th bed side mirror. It's still puffy and blotchy from the pe spray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks up at Mini.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah...vanity, the most predictable of sins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I...can't. You two go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is dark and quiet, as the evening dew rises on the law

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diane is almost asleep when the phone next to the bed RIN waking her up. She stares at it for a moment, trying to decide if she should answer it. On the forth ring, she answers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A DIAL TONE rings in her ear. She hangs up the phone. A second later it RINGS again. She waits two rings and then answers. Again a DIAL TONE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now a bit freaked, Diane is fully awake and staring at th phone, waiting... PLINK! Something small hits the window across the room. Startled, she turns her head towards it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DIANE'S POV: Through the window, in the distance by the hedges a BLACK CLAD FIGURE is visible, wearing a ski mask goggles. In the figure's right hand there is a gleaming, sharp kitchen knife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She can't believe her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HER POV: The figure stands silently, bringing the knife u indicating that he's going to cut her throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eyes wild with panic, Diane picks up the phone and dials

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The phone dials and she waits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, please, oh god.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks back out the window: THE HOODED FIGURE walks ou the bushes and heads towards the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have reached 911, if this is an emergency, please remain on the line...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh god, oh god!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diane realizes she doesn't have time to wait and runs out the room, leaving the phone off the hook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diane stumbles down the hallway, almost tripping on the s down to the living room. She goes straight for the phone the end table next to the couch. She picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please continue to hold, your call will be answered...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hangs up the phone and looks back at the hallway, but she does, she sees reflected in a wall mirror: ANOTHER BL CLAD FIGURE outside the living room window, but this one holds a HAND AXE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns around to look out the window. THE FIGURE raise the axe slowly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...no...help! Help!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She heads towards the front door to scream for help, but axe wielding figure moves swiftly towards the door, makin unsafe for her to even try. Her face dissolves into utter despair, as she stumbles out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diane runs in to check that the sliding doors are locked. clicks the lock shut, just as THE FIRST FIGURE with the k appears in the door frame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, God! Help! Someone!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diane is transfixed by her own eyes reflected in the lens of the goggles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly ) No, please, no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She slowly backs away from the door, as the figure tries open it. The door frame rattles on its track, as the figu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: violently tugs at the handle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help! Someone please, help me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She runs back in, checking THE WINDOW. It's clear. She decides to check the front door. She runs over and looks the peep hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PEEP HOLE POV: It appears clear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She starts to undo the lock and then slowly peeks through slit in the door, leaving the chain on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THROUGH THE SLIT: everything looks good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She opens the door and looks towards the front gate, whic open. She looks as if she's thinking of making a dash for gates. Just then, from behind the gate, steps the AXE WIELDING FIGURE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It shakes a finger "no" at her, as it walks towards the house. Terrified, she slams the door, locking it behind h She instinctively pushes her back against the door, hyper ventilating. She looks up at the ceiling, her eyes fillin with tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please God, please God...please!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks around the room, searching for options. Suddenl her eyes bulge as she sees THE KNIFE WIELDING FIGURE stan not ten feet away in the door to the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diane screams and runs back down the hallway, towards the bedroom. The knife wielding figure follows behind her. Sh looks back, as it runs after her, grabbing her by the shoulder. She shrieks and struggles out of it's grasp bef running in the bathroom and slamming the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diane throws her weight against the door, struggling to k the intruder out. She looks for anything to help her, and then sees in the window to the bathroom...THE AXE WIELDIN FIGURE standing silently, staring back at her.

dialogues.speaker: D
dialogues.text: iane collapses to the floor in a pool of tears. She looks again at THE WINDOW: It's empty. The pushing on the door suddenly stops, but Diane is so disturbed, she doesn't no through her sobs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A PAIR OF BLACK GLOVED HANDS puts the bedroom phone back its cradle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our work finished...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mini and Martin laugh and giggle at the enormous slabs of beef put in front of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We rewarded ourselves on a job well done...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mini and Martin walk down the hallway towards the master bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we returned home expecting to find her blabbering like a three year old.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom, we're home!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diane, honey, we brought you a pulled pork plate!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They reach the door to the bathroom. It's still closed. Martin and Mini exchange a look, not believing that Diane could still be in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey? You okay?...Honey?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin tries the door. Diane still appears to be leaning against it. He pushes hard on the door, opening it a few inches. Mini reaches in and shoves Diane over so they can open the door. She appears drugged. They lay her flat and to wake her up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diane, it's us, wake up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mini slaps her hard across the face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (feigning concern) Wake up, Mommy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mini.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Killjoy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin lightly taps Diane's cheeks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diane, come on, come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mini looks up at the counter. AN EMPTY BOTTLE OF PRESCRIP SLEEPING PILLS lies open next to the sink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin...

dialogues.speaker: H
dialogues.text: e looks up and immediately sees the bottle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I picked that prescription up three days ago. It was probably more than half full.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two of them look at each other, studying each other's reaction. Seconds go by as both wait for the other to mak the first move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (eerily calm) I suppose we should call an ambulance?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The suggestion hangs in the air, as Martin feels Diane's wrist again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her pulse is almost gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you really think they can save her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I...I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She'll only try it again. You know she will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She will if we keep this torture up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin looks down at Diane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suddenly with resolve) This is wrong, call an ambulance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on, who are we to say her choice was wrong? She put those pills in her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mini--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't "Mini" me, you've been bankrolling my little project from day one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We both agreed murder was out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd hardly call it murder, if anything, we're just helping to fulfill her last wish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She wouldn't have taken the pills if we hadn't- (urgently) Mini, for gods sake, she still has a pulse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So do people in comas. It's just a matter of time-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mini, we-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, you can drop the indignant outrage, because if you really cared, you'd have already grabbed the phone and dialed 911 by now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's got him and he knows it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softening) Can't we just admit how lucky we are? It's the perfect alibi, she put the drugs in her system.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Just leave her here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you think of one person she knows who would say she's sane at this point? This is just the natural, sad and inevitable conclusion to a tragic life.

dialogues.speaker: M
dialogues.text: artin ponders the choice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're this close from being free...let's just let nature take its course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mini and Martin sit watching a game show called Absolutel Positive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And so we passed the time watching my favorite show.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A YOUNG MALE GAME SHOW HOST comes out on stage to the applause of the audience.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome to "Absolutely Positive!" The show where we give couples about to get married a last chance to make sure they're...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts a hand to his ear, encouraging the studio audienc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely Positive!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right! We send them out on one last date with someone other than their fiance, so they can be sure they're really ready to make that lifelong commitment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our neighbor, Mike Rudell, the scumbag at my birthday, produces it and it's so twisted, I'm surprised I didn't think of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the screen, the host introduces THE COUPLE, who nervou walk out to the studio applause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take happy couples about to marry and try to break them up. The catch is the couples are always sent on dates with people just a little better looking than their fiancГ©s.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then the TWO DATES are brought out to sit on either side the couple. Both dates are, indeed, slightly better looki than the engaged couple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mini checks Diane's pulse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we waited some more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin sits on the couch. He looks up as Mini comes in fr the bathroom, shaking her head "no", indicating she's not

dialogues.speaker: I
dialogues.text: dead yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mini checks Diane's pulse again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Typical mom, she managed to fuck up her last act of free will...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The 11 O'clock news is starting, as Mini impatiently look towards the hallway leading to the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally, it was time to do the only humane thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mini stands up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's time to speed this up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speed this up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't wait anymore, our alibi is only believable for maybe another hour. We can say that after dinner we went to a movie, but if she hasn't croaked by midnight, you can forget about this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin looks at her for a long moment, clearly realizing implications of "speed this up".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm sorry, this is going somewhere I'm not prepared to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, but you were prepared to sit here until the pills did her in? I hate to break it to you, but wherever you "weren't prepared to go"...the hypocrite express just rolled into the station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin stares straight ahead, coming to grips with the tr of his actions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you suggesting?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I thought we'd disembowel her and leave her for the raccoons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin recoils.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kidding...God, you've lost your sense of humor. Don't worry, it'll be painless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin takes a deep breath, considering his options.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mini goes through her mother's clothes, as Diane lies crumpled in a heap on the floor. Martin looks on impatien

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To be honest, I think we both knew in our hearts it would come to this. And as my first assisted suicide, I was going to make it flawless. M

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, we don't have time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, if we're going to screw up the details we might as well call San Quentin and tell them to fire up the dutch oven. (off his confusion) The gas chamber? (exasperated) Martin, please, I can't explain everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mini holds a chic black Chanel suit up to the full length mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mini applying make-up and lipstick to Diane's face in fro of her vanity mirror. Martin holds Diane's head still.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think this is a good idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you lost your mind, "Mr. Public Relations"? What's the one thing all her friends are going to be talking about when they find out? (waits for his answer) "How did she look"? Do you think anyone will think twice if the answer is "fabulous"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door to the dark garage opens and Mini turns on a lig Martin, carrying Diane (now dressed in the suit) over his shoulder, struggles through the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mini props Diane up in the driver's seat and begins touch up the make-up. She ties a silk scarf around Diane's neck ever so elegantly. Satisfied, she turns the ignition key lowers all the power windows in the car. She looks up at Martin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, if you've got anything to say to her, now would be the time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could you just pretend to have a little remorse?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mini and Martin walk through the door to the garage and c it behind them. The hum of the car engine can he heard through the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diane sits in the driver's seat, as THE EXHAUST PIPE spew

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: fumes into the sealed garage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The garage door is open and Diane's body is visible on th garage floor as Martin and Mini kneel beside her. The wai an ambulance siren is heard as it pulls up in front, cutt the engine. Mini comes running outside in tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help us, please! My mom, I think she's dead!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO PARAMEDICS try to revive Diane, having laid her out o the floor of the garage. Mini sobs hysterically, as Marti hugs her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mommy, wake up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay, sweetheart, everything's going to be okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Tannen, I think you should take your daughter in the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, please, don't let her die!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two POLICE CRUISERS are parked outside as Diane's body, n wrapped in a body bag, is being wheeled into the ambulanc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A FEW "LOOKY LOOS" are standing at the gates to the house interested to see what's happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the paramedics fills out a report on a clipboard i the background, as Martin continues to comfort Mini. A MA 30, with a slightly weary look, walks in the front door wearing an off-the-rack grey suit and barber shop haircut

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Tannen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Detective Bill Garson, LAPD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry to be here right now, but whenever there's an apparent suicide we are required to do an investigation to rule out homicide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (clearly surprised) Oh...uh...right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's really just a formality.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (exploding) My mother just killed herself! They haven't even taken her away yet! What's wrong with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mini, please! He's just doing his job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell him to leave! This is outrageous!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Garson) Could we do this another time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course we--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mini looks at Martin, relieved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I do need to ask just a few simple questions before I go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't you hear him?! He said--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sharply) Mini, it's okay...just go lie down for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin stands in the garage with Garson, going over what happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So after dinner and the movie, we came home at around 11:30 and found her in the garage. I turned off the car and opened the garage door to let out the exhaust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about trying to revive your wife?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin seems a bit taken aback by the question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course, we did that too, but I couldn't feel a pulse. Mini took a course at school in CPR and tried that, but... (taking a breath) it didn't work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So your wife did this sometime between 8:00 and 11:33 when you placed the 911 call?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I ask why you left your wife alone when she had been acting in such an unstable state?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We never thought she'd do anything like...this. After the episode in the mall, Diane hadn't left the house for three days and my daughter and I just needed a break. It's been a very stressful time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. So this was your wife's car?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was it in the garage when you left for dinner or did she drive it in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was it in the garage when you left?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a little flustered) Is, is that important?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just trying to reconstruct what happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, well...after she was brought home from the mall, the car was towed here and we put it in the garage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And no one drove it during those three days?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Mini and I have our own cars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are going to have to impound it for a few days to take it to the crime lab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crime lab? Oh, okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again, purely routine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you found a note yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confused) I'm sorry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Garson's eyes flicker for a split second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A suicide note? The deceased usually leaves one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh...right, no...not yet. But we haven't really looked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mind if I take a look around?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin hesitates for just a split second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...of course not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mini and Martin whisper together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who cares if we didn't leave a note? Just relax.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But they said it's--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what? He'll do his little dance and chalk it up to another failed actress who realized after forty she might as well be dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (remembering something) Oh, shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sweatsuits and goggles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I already snuck out the back and threw them in Mike Rudell's garbage cans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (exhaling) Good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angelpie, just relax, we did it, we're free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin and Mini arrive in a shuttle bus in front of the l resort.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After the funeral, I felt it would be good idea if we took a vacation and went somewhere where we could act like a real couple for the first time.

dialogues.speaker: M
dialogues.text: artin tips the BELL HOP on the way out and the moment the door closes, Mini jumps into his arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin agreed and let me pick the place. I chose Las Hadas in Mexico, because that's where Dudley Moore and Bo Derek did it in Ten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin spreads sun tan lotion on Mini's back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I figured sugar daddy/younger woman would be old news down there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few other OLDER MAN/YOUNGER WOMAN couples lounge near t mixed among more traditional pairings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARIACHIS play a sexy Mexican ballad as Mini, wearing a t sundress, dances very close with Martin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could feel that Martin had let the whole thing with the cops go. It had been two weeks since Mom's death and it already felt like it happened a year ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mini lies on top of Martin on a lounge chair. They both s up at the stars. The gentle breaking of waves further add the tranquility of the evening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I've been thinking that I might enjoy working in your office this summer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?   Sure, if you want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She moves to kiss him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin, Mini? Is that you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin and Mini look up to see MIKE RUDELL, their produce neighbor, peering at them in the dark. He has an arm wrap around the waist of A YOUNG BLONDE who is clearly Playmat material.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I swear I thought Martin was going to wet himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mini quickly sits up, trying to make it look like innocen father/daughter closeness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (extremely tense) Oh...hi, Mike, what, what are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: R
dialogues.text: udell comes over, clearly aware of how un-father/daughter they were lying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last week Mini mentioned you two were coming here for a little R&R, and I suddenly realized I hadn't taken a vacation in god knows when. Jennifer, this is my neighbor Martin Tannen and his daughter, Mini.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin barely looks at Jennifer as he shakes her hand. Sh looks equally uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, but, Jennifer, have we met? You look so familiar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer looks quite uneasy, as she forces a smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the icing is that Jennifer works for the same escort service that I did. Now this is rich.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanted you both to know how sorry I am for your loss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our loss? He just lost six or seven freebies a year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If there's anything I can do... (to Mini) for either of you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yikes, now that Mom's out of the way, I guess I'm fair game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...don't hesitate to ask. Remember I'm just right across the fence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The meaning is not lost on Martin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (measured) Thanks, Mike, we appreciate it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin paces back and forth as Mini sits on the bed. His muscles bulge with frustration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did you tell him?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was just being friendly, I had no idea he'd decide to come here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He knows. He found the clothes and goggles and he fucking knows!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I doubt he even knows where his trash cans are.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: You're overreacting. It's just coincidence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well coincidence or not, he saw us together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was dark, I sat up before he saw anything. M

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, he knows. It was like he was toying with us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just relax, what is he going to do? Go home and tell everyone we're a couple? We'll just laugh it off and tell everyone he vacations with hookers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin stops and looks at her, surprised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, come on, could that little moment between you and Jennifer have been any more awkward?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His face turns a little red.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not jealous or anything, I just think it's funny. Talk about six degrees of penetration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin rubs his temples, clearly overwhelmed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You realize he could blackmail us? If the police found out about us, that suicide wouldn't look so routine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin, please, calm down. Trust me, nothing is going to happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her words don't appear to have calmed him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin sits on a lounger, reading a book and looking very unhappy. From the pool, Mini emerges, soaking wet in a bikini.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The next few days were a laugh riot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin looks up from the book, looking around suspiciousl Suddenly, Mini appears behind him and gives him a kiss on mouth. He instinctively pulls back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, Martin was acting like he really was my father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then, Rudell and his bimbo enter the pool area, wavi at them. Mini's head is not close enough for the scene to look incriminating, but Martin is too spooked to know the difference.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mini and Martin sit watching TV. Mini flips channels, stopping at Absolutely, Positive! Martin snatches the rem and grumpily changes M channels. Mini looks very annoyed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We returned home and things didn't get much better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mini trying on various sexy outfits in front of her mirro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -Catholic School girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What little sex we were having    was getting dull.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -Cheerleader.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quite frankly, with my little project successfully completed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -Naughty Nurse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was bored. I became concerned that in my world of firsts I had achieved my greatest first...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -French Maid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...at too young an age.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -Marilyn Monroe in the sequined dress she sang to JFK in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (singing breathily) "Happy birthday, Mr. President"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As for school, well, I was just in no state to return to my studies after the trauma of my mother's death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE DOOR BELL RINGS. Mini looks towards the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mini answers it, having removed her Marilyn wig, but stil the sequined dress. Detective Garson stands at the door, looking her up and down. Mini hides her surprise well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Minerva Tannen, Detective Garson, I don't know if you remember me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drogues, my last name is Drogues. And "yes", I remember you, you were the big hearted lug who wanted your questions answered while my mother was still warm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ignoring her dig) So, Mr. Tannen is your stepfather?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice work, McGruff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again, I am sorry about that night, but it is policy that we get the preliminary facts as soon as possible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to ask you a few more questions about your mother's death.    M

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, come on in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mini leads him in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, it's stupid as hell to talk to a cop without a lawyer, but I didn't want to look jumpy and my first real interrogation? I could feel something tingle deep inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mini and Garson take a seat. Mini lights a cigarette. Gar looks over her outfit again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a little early for the prom, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A girl can dream, can't she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perfectly legal. So, anyway, we got the preliminary coroner's report. Although the pills knocked her out, she died of the carbon monoxide poisoning from the exhaust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it that important?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it's just a little unusual for a suicide victim to use two methods. Her choices seemed, I don't know how to put it... improvisational.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, maybe she wanted to drift off before the fumes got her? She clearly put some thought into that outfit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clearly...But dying from carbon monoxide poisoning is actually pretty painless, you just basically pass out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I doubt she would have had an intimate knowledge of how car fumes feel when you choke on them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I suppose you're right...Also we checked the phone records and there was a 911 call placed at 8:12. It was a hang up and when the 911 dispatcher called back a few minutes later, there was no answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any idea why she'd call 911?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okie fine, this may be the most exciting thing I've done in a while, but even I know when the rush isn't worth the risk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I think you should come back when my father's around. He'll be upset I let a stranger in the house.    G

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you're safe with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even so, he won't be happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not a problem, will he be home tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin is on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you let him in?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mini lounges in a bikini, talking on the cordless phone, while sucking on a red popsicle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I played it cool, it would've looked worse to be defensive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mini looks across the yard to see...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MIKE RUDELL looking down at her from the upstairs balcony his home. He's dressed in a plush terry cloth robe and is smoking a pipe, which he raises in greeting. His eyes are locked on hers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, when's he coming over?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tonight!? I've got a dinner with Chapman. I've already cancelled-- (frustrated) Damn it! Why didn't you call me?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RUDELL allows the folds of his robe to open in the breeze revealing his chest and pair of silk boxers. He's in good shape for a man his age.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (annoyed) Hey, I didn't know you had plans!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mini responds to Rudell's challenge, lowering a strap on bikini top.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, I'll be home early so we can get the story straight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mini hangs up the phone, removing the popsicle slowly fro her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin and Mini sit across from Garson. Martin appears co and relaxed, a scotch in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I really appreciate you taking the time to help us out. There's just a few loose ends we want to tie up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely. What would you like to know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Garson opens his briefcase and removes a report. He start

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: leafing through papers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There appears to be some question as to the time of death. You said you went to dinner and a movie-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Detective, not to be overly sensitive, but do I need my lawyer here? Because these sound like the questions one asks when there's a homicide investigation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Tannen, I'd really like to just finish this up, I've got real homicides that need attention. How about if I just ask you some questions and the one's you don't want to answer, we'll just skip?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That sounds good, doesn't it, Dad? I mean, let's just get this over with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin looks at Mini, trying hard not to allow his anger escape for a second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fair enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terrific...now, the preliminary blood report indicated she had ritalin in her system.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mini's eyes shift between Garson and his note pad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wasn't aware my wife was taking ritalin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neither was her physician, he had never prescribed it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, as you may have discovered by now, my wife had substance abuse problems, I'm sure there were many drugs she took without a prescription.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, but it's an odd drug to be taking. It's mostly given to adults and children with Attention Deficit Disorder to calm them. But in people who don't need it, it has the reverse effect, making them incredibly hyper and agitated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again, Detective, I really can't say why she was taking these drugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fair enough...Mr. Tannen, were you and your wife close?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...we led, for the most part, separate lives. We had decided to stay together for Mini.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O oh...sacrifice personal happiness for the benefit of the child. Excellent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, Detective Garson, I must admit I don't see the relevance of these questions. Diane was an extremely disturbed person. Haven't you interviewed enough people who saw her at her worst?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, but what I'm still unclear about is her time of death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that makes two of us... Again, detective, we were out for the whole evening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at his notes) After dinner you saw a movie that night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Start time 9 o'clock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you see?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That new Jackie Chan movie where the terrorists try to blow up Mount Rushmore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Running time 115 minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahh...My buddy told me the end is crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For god sakes, does he think we wouldn't actually see it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, he slides down Washington's nose with the bomb strapped to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad...Don't give it away, he hasn't seen it yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin turns to Mini, giving her a fatherly smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another demerit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mini rolls her eyes at Garson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's okay...Where did you see it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Galleria.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drive time 17 minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you got home at?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precisely...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With 12 minutes of previews. You didn't think we'd forget the previews?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, if there aren't any more questions, it is a school night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, that about wraps it up for now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For now? Detective we are trying very hard to put our lives back together, but every time you come by, it just dredges everything back up. We've told you everything we know.     G

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish I could be more definitive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'm telling you the next time you have a question, it had better be because you're charging us-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin momentarily freezes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just asking you to please let us deal with our grief and get on with our lives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (standing) Thanks again for your time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mini sits in a chair as Martin paces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell was I thinking, letting you talk me into this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's probably just routine stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was not routine, my dear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice use of the word "us", by the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, it just slipped out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I had a nickel for every time I heard that-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sharply) Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, just chill, I'm sure this will blow over in a few days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chill?! Believe me, we'll be chilling in a pine box if he figures everything out. You do understand they could go for the death penalty?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's probably just trying to spook us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?! They don't try and spook you unless they think you did it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was a great plan, no one can prove we stuck those sleeping pills in her mouth, because we didn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (seething) Well, if it was such a great plan, why am I cancelling business dinners to accommodate a detective who appears convinced it wasn't a suicide?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mini glares at him and then stands up, heading inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll see you later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The club is packed with YOUNG LATINO CLUBHOPPERS gyrating the pulsating beat. Mini, in a tight crimson dress, has attracted quite a crowd, as she dances very provocatively with a MUSCULAR YOUNG LATINO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would he follow?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His face and shoulders glisten with sweat, as she lifts o leg around his waist and then the other. As she straddles him, their hips rocking together, she puts her arms aroun his neck and leans all the way back, her hair hanging dow ecstasy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she pulls herself back up, her eyes scan the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARTIN stands in the back, watching her, his eyes sullen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was there any question?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mini's eyes move quickly enough past him that it's ambigu to him whether she spotted him or not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin watches as Mini leans in and in SLOW MOTION gives partner a deep, long kiss. MARTIN looks ill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mini's car pulls into the driveway. She gets out, looking rumpled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mini walks in to find Martin, sitting at the table in a bathrobe. He's reading the paper, with a cup of coffee. M opens the fridge and removes a carton of orange juice, ta a big slug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A phone call would have been appreciated at some point. I was worried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Worried that refugee from a J.Lo video rode me `til the tires fell off?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh...Martin, I'm not sure you're aware, but at this point you can't be my dad and my lover. Where I go and how late I stay out is my business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wasn't saying that as a dad. (very sincere) Before your mother and I...grew apart, I would worry if she was out late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that's sweet, but I'm not her and I can assure you I won't end up passed out in some greaseball's fuck pad with my panties around my ankles... (cold, smooth) u nless I choose to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell's gotten into you? I just expressed concern for you and you turn around and threaten me? Mini, in a relationship, it's okay to worry about someone else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I kind of have to admire this. He really is one of the world's premiere bullshit artists.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haven't you ever been in a relationship?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The questions hangs in the air. Mini looks down, almost ashamed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My god, you haven't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She tries to hold back the tears as she looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congratulations... (sniffling) you're my first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He comes over and gives her a very sweet hug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, angel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I'd like to thank the academy and god and, oh yeah, "Free Tibet".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin rides up in the elevator with other OFFICE WORKERS His eyes look tired from staying up all night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fake tears aside...he actually was my first relationship. Which, in itself, was significant, because I had always felt that by living my life by the rule of firsts, I would never be able to find someone who could accept me on those terms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He strides off the elevator sending "hellos" and nods to employees, as he passes the large corporate logo: "BOYD, MATHER, TANNEN & ASSOCIATES".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I was willing to give him the chance to be that person...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches his desk, where his YOUNG SECRETARY, LOIS, is waiting with an envelope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...if he could just hold it together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morning, Lois.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Tannen, this just arrived for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hands him a manila envelope marked "MARTIN TANNEN- VI MESSENGER". He takes it from her and walks into his offic sitting down. He opens the package to find an 8x10 glossy photo of:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MINI SITTING WITH HIM AT THE POOL IN MEXICO. The caption reads: "THANK HEAVEN FOR LITTLE GIRLS".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's when things started to get interesting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin looks up, the empty look in his eyes revealing a terrified mind already calculating the potential outcomes examines THE ENVELOPE. There is a SPEEDWAY COURIER STICKE but no return address.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin angrily honks his horn in slow traffic as he talks his cell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lois, I need you to re-schedule the Chapman meeting... (listening) I know...Tell him...tell him it's an unavoidable emergency.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin stands at the front desk, talking to A CLERK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean you don't keep records on who your senders are?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When it's paid cash, we only keep records on packages, not envelopes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin walks outside, frustrated. His cell goes off and h answers it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Tannen, I just spoke to Mr. Chapman...he told me to tell you that he's going to be seeking a new firm to handle his company's needs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin's jaw tightens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Lois.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin hangs up the phone, as he looks up, he sees across street a large sign on a modern office building: RUDELL WORLDWIDE ENTERTAINMENT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin closes his eyes, trying to remain in control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin walks into the office to find his partners, STEVE and CHARLES MATHER waiting for him. Martin looks surprise and concerned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve? Charlie? What, what are you doing in town? Why didn't you tell me you were coming--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We just heard about Chapman...not that it matters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't afford to lose any more clients.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The color drains from Martin's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, guys, my wife just committed suicide...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one's saying this isn't a difficult time for you, but whatever's been distracting you started long before that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's just no way to sugarcoat this...you're a liability we can't afford anymore...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin sits very still, his world crumbling around him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fifteen years...we've been--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (curtly) We'll be asking all our clients who they would prefer to stay with, and of course, you'll have an equal shot to make your case with them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin continues to stare off into space, reeling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin sits in the traffic on Beverly Glen. The veins in neck are starting to bulge as he stares straight ahead. Suddenly, he starts pounding on the steering wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fucking shit! Fucking shit! Fucking shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then, he looks over to the next car. A three year ol GIRL in the back seat holds up her "PO" TELETUBBY DOLL to show him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through a BINOCULAR'S VIEWFINDER: Rudell is seen through window talking on the phone, unaware he's being watched.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at that smug prick...He's fucking with me and I will not be fucked with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin and Mini stand in the dark kitchen, as Martin peer out the window through binoculars at RUDELL across the ya

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you gonna do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin goes to a drawer and removes the LARGE KNIFE they bought at Williams Sonoma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna go over there and tell him to back off or he's gonna get hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you crazy? We're not even positive it's him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My god, the picture was dropped off at a messenger service right across the street from his office! He was the only person at the resort who knew who we were!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He could go to the cops and tell them you threatened him, then they'd really start investigating us. It's just one photo and you can't even really tell if it's me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That son of bitch just cost me the firm I worked fifteen years to build.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, if you start waving that thing around, he's gonna cost you a lot more than that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mini lies awake, looking annoyed as Martin keeps turning shifting in bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin didn't sleep at all that night and made damn well sure I didn't either.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mini walks up the long driveway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With Mommy Dearest out of the way, I decided to take the matter of Rudell into my own hands. I knew Martin wouldn't approve, but at this point...action had to be taken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She arrives at the front door and rings the bell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would catch him off guard, disorient him and then kill him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens and Rudell stands before her in the same p bathrobe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...with kindness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Mr. Rudell, I'm sorry to bother you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not at all, as I said down in Mexico... (slightly lascivious) anything for a neighbor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I come in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eighteen foot ceilings frame the room, garishly decorated with very modern, modular furniture. Rudell leads Mini in

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow, I haven't been here since you redecorated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was just finished. I'm sorry your mother never got to see it completed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know she'd approve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you don't mind me asking, ...how are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's been hard, but I guess I've just been telling myself that she's probably much happier where she is now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're absolutely-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Positive!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mini giggles, almost embarrassed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (chuckling) Well, that too, but "correct" was the word I was thinking of. Do you like the show?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, god, it's my favorite. I love how you never know if the couples will decide to stay together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could arrange for you to go to the set one day if you'd like, or even be a contestant?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A contestant? Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, those dates are really quite harmless. You just spend an evening with the person. We prep you on what to say before the show.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It sounds like fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudell lets his eyes take a walk all over her. Mini, keen aware, blushes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway, what's on your mind?
