dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, um...this may sound strange, but you haven't seen any suspicious looking people around our house lately?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, is everything okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, it's just that since mom's death, someone sent us a photo of Martin and I together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Together?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It indicated that we were...I know this sounds crazy, but...a couple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A couple? You and Martin? Hmmm...I mean, certainly older men and younger women are an (searching again) ...accepted part of society, but for someone to do that, well...it's just tasteless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly, so we're just trying to figure who Rit could be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmm, I haven't noticed anyone at all...Out of curiosity, what kind of a picture could they send you to indicate that you and Martin were together?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, it wasn't like we were naked or anything. I mean, of course, he's seen me naked, he is my step- father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mini and Rudell sit at a table, enjoying iced teas, as Mi flirts shamelessly with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Much to my surprise, I was invited to stay for a refreshing beverage...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudell shows Mini around his collection of rare tropical flowers. He plucks a tiger lily off a stem and puts it in hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew he had had no shortage of young women in his bed, but he had been paying for it in one form or another for a long time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudell shows Mini how to use a pitching wedge on the smal putting green off his back patio. He stands behind her, wrapping his arms around her, guiding her arms through th swing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the one undeniable fact I had learned from Martin is that there is no greater thrill or triumph in a man's life...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudell makes her a giant banana split, covering it with w cream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...than getting a ripe young woman to open the gates to heaven for no other reason than she wanted to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He accidently gets some whip cream on his nose. Mini reac over and wipes it off, licking her finger clean. Rudell t to hide the wonderment in his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frankly, I'm surprised the anticipation of pulling off a mother-daughter double dip didn't give him a stroke right there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mini walks out, skipping down the path, singing "The Cand Man" to herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Who can take tomorrow? Dip it in a dream, separate the sorrow and collect up all the cream, the candy man, oh, the candy man can"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I left that day, exhilarated in the knowledge that in one afternoon, I had turned Rudell into a trout on a line...and he'd follow me anywhere I tugged the pole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (singing) "The candy man can 'cause he mixes it with love and makes the world taste good..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mini walks down the corridor with Kayla.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The photos stopped coming and although Martin was freaking out about his business, things were returning to normal. I even decided to return to school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They approach TROY, the football player she humiliated earlier. Mini raises two fingers to her mouth in a "V", simulating cunnilingus, taunting Troy. His friends laugh he wilts, pretending he didn't see her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mini and Kayla walk in with other students. Her teacher, Warren Bishop, comes over to her immediately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mini, I've got a message for you to go to the principal's office right away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mini is led in by A SECRETARY, as Detective Garson sits i chair next to PRINCIPAL PATTY ANDREWS, 50.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then things got interesting again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mini immediately sizes up the situation and takes on the appropriate concerned tone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Detective Garson, is everything all right?

dialogues.speaker: A
dialogues.text: black and white surveillance tape of one of the school's hallways is seen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mini, this tape was shot a week before your mother's death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door to the nurses office is seen opening and Nurse HauptfГјhrer walks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The next day, the school nurse reported two bottles of Ritalin missing from the medicine cabinet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few seconds later, Mini is seen entering the nurse's office, checking over her shoulder to make sure no one sa her. THE TAPE FREEZES, then fast forwards. Mini is seen leaving the office, stuffing something in her pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A TV and VCR sit on a rolling cabinet in the corner, as Garson puts down the remote and looks at Mini. Principal Andrews is not pleased.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've lifted two prints from the door and the inside of the medicine cabinet. They don't match the nurse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mini, is there something you'd like to say to Detective Garson?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mini eyes remain calm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we see the tape of the Der FГјhrer sucking down her afternoon fix of Smirnoff, or don't you have cameras in the bathroom stalls?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Young lady, stealing anything, especially prescription drugs is a serious matter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mini looks at Andrews, her eyes suddenly starting to tear

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got me, okay?   But what was I supposed to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suddenly hysterical) She...She said if I didn't, she was...was gonna--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?   Another student?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My mother! She made me steal them for her! I didn't want to, but she said she was going to send me to boarding school in Canada if I didn't!   P

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Canada?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sobbing) The Yukon territories! Are you happy, now? You got me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my lord, I had know idea, she was--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An addict? Detective Garson knew! We told him, and now what? The whole school's gonna know!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mini hides her face in her hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's dead, my mommy's dead. Can't we just leave her be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andrews casts a harsh glance at a frustrated Garson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Detective Garson, I assume, there won't be a need to press charges against Ms. Drogues?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mini holds out her wrists to Garson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sniffling) You gonna cuff me, Copper!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Garson looks at Mini, clearly not convinced of her innoce

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's free to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin gets off the elevator and heads across the lobby. GARSON and A UNIFORMED OFFICER approach him. Martin looks little unnerved to see them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, Mr. Tannen, we were just coming up to see you. Have you got a minute?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Detective, I told you no more questions without my lawyer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you'd better call him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin sits at a table, conferring with his lawyer, NED VOLANT, an impeccably dressed operator with a mane of thi heavily gelled hair. Garson sits across from them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a small discrepancy that I can't quite figure out and I was hoping you might be able to explain it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I suppose I can try.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The final toxicology report came back and your wife definitely didn't die from the pills. She wasn't conscious past 9:30, but it was the fumes that killed her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, hallelujah, thanks for the update-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin, easy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, but this is harassment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See, here's what I needed to ask you. The gas tank in the Jag was almost full, just a gallon had been used.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, if she was unconscious by 9:30, that means the car must have been running for at least two hours when you found her. An unconscious person can't turn on a car, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Detective, with all due respect, could you get to the point?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, here's where I get confused, see, that particular model idling for two hours will burn at least four gallons of gas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin tries to remain calm, as the panic starts to settl for a long stay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, there's really no way the tank could be almost full if it was running for two hours. Is there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at Martin, waiting for an answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, I guess what I'm asking is, whose idea was it to put her in the car?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin, don't say anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, Mr. Tannen, you clearly had the most to gain from her death, but I've learned from a number of your wife's friends that she and Mini had a strained relationship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again, Detective, my client won't be answering anything, so let's just cut the cat and mouse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like Mr. Tannen to know that if he's trying to be a protective father by covering up something Mini did, I'd be careful. The district attorney is viewing this case as an opportunity to show the public that the rich don't get away with murder in this town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin whispers something in Volant's ear and he in turn,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: whispers back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does this mean he's offering Mr. Tannen immunity if he says he was protecting his daughter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Garson takes a sip of water, as Martin anxiously waits fo his answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a strong possibility. But he wants Mr. Tannen to know he will go for the maximum sentence if he doesn't. No manslaughter, no plea bargains, nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin's eyes shift slightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Garson, now finished with Martin, sits across from Mini a her lawyer, HERB PELHAM, who doesn't look nearly as confi as Martin's lawyer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was Colonel Mustard in the library with the candlestick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Garson smiles at Mini, admiring her resolve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nervously) Uh...Miss Drogues, as your lawyer-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't wet your pants, I know when to shut up and swallow...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mini takes out a sip a water, letting a trickle of liquid roll down her chin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...my tongue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even Garson appears a little intimidated by the overt flirtation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, the fact that the marriage was unhappy and there was no pre- nup gives all the motive to Martin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you want me to say it was his idea?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If it was his idea, give me one reason you should take the fall?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At that moment I knew we had him. If he was trying to get me to rat on Martin, he didn't have enough to charge either one of us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So if I tell the jury it was his idea and I was scared for my life, because he said he'd kill me if I ever told anyone, then I walk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Garson instinctively leans forward in his chair, just a b Mini stares into Garson's eyes, unflinching. She looks ar the room, weighing her options. Pelham attempts to whispe something in her ear. She waves him off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, sport, but I'll take my chances.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mini and Martin drive home together. There is an icy chil between them, as Martin looks over at Mini.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never doubted for a minute you were going to hold firm. Not a second. I hope you know that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I knew...I knew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. You realize, we've got to rely on each other?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who else do we have?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly. We're almost home free. My lawyer says that gas gauge theory is circumstantial as hell. I've only got one concern now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudell. If a jury knew we were a couple, we've both got a motive and that changes everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mini puts her hand on Martin's, reassuringly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baby, don't worry about him, he's just jealous 'cause you've still got rockin' abs and a better hairline.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin looks over at her, softening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even if he did send that picture, what does it prove?...Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mini walks through the mall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For all of Martin's talk of relying on each other...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARTIN follows about a hundred yards behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Garson had succeeded in planting the seeds of distrust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MINI turns around and Martin ducks into a boutique.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mini walks out of a movie theater, with Kayla and TWO BOY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our relationship had turned into what some might call...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few seconds later, Martin walks out of the theater, wea dark glasses and a hat. He follows them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...unhealthy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mini sits in front of the TV, watching a commercial. She wearing the same "Fuct" T-shirt she wore when we first me her. Her eyes are filled with anticipation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something had to give, and ironically enough, it was the night I was making my television debut.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: I had asked Martin to be home by eight for a big surprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin walks in the front door with his briefcase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, hey, come and watch. You're missing me, I'm on TV!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurry up, the commercial's almost over!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin walks over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely Positive! Comes back on and we see that MINI a MALE CONTESTANT are sitting on either side of this show's BLONDE HAIRED ENGAGED COUPLE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mini and her male counterpart are just a bit better looki than the engaged couple, both of whom have a midwestern wholesomeness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARTIN'S FACE turns white.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE HOST turns to the camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome back to Absolutely Positive. Now it's time to hear how the date between Jason and Mini ended.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You? You went on-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I thought it'd be a gas...now shhh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason, you said that the reason you wanted to come on the show was to test your ability to resist temptation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a bit nervous) Well, since Becky and I have dated since high school and decided to remain virgins until marriage, I just wanted to go on a date with another girl just to see how I would react. You know, whether there'd be any feelings of doubt about my decision?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, after dinner, what happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, gosh, well she suggested we go to a dance club she knew. I'm not really a good dancer, but I said "yes."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hurt) We never go dancing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason smiles at her uncomfortably.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, Mini, is Jason a good dancer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, he's a damn quick learner, and not just at dancing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARTIN shoots a look at Mini

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin, for god's sake, that was their line. You think I talk like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, really? So there was some other teacher-student stuff going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (uncomfortable) Uh, no, not really-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, come on, what about when we went back to your place?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You what?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I, I don't know what she's talking about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, don't be bashful. He put on some soft music and-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! This isn't true, why are you-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We started kissing and-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Mini) Shut up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OOOOHHHHH!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, Jay-Jay, it was really special. (to the host) He loves to be called "Jay-Jay".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You, you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me tell you, Becky, you're in for a wild ride from this Bronco.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHOOOOOOAAAA!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARTIN staring at Mini.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did, did you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You slept with her?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, Martin, it was a one time thing. He was a virgin, how could I say "no"? Believe me, she'll thank me after their wedding night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You had me come home early to-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be jealous. It won't happen again. It was just a goof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin stands there, speechless, while ON THE SCREEN:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKY dissolves into a puddle of tears as Jason tries to console her. Suddenly, she runs off stage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARTIN picks up the remote and hits "mute".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudell? He let you go on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I thought it would be fun. I wasn't really supposed to, you know, "go all the way" but-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe you...th-that couple, you ruined their relationship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, but the show is called Absolutely Positive for a reason. Clearly, the only thing Jason was positive about was-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a sick little twist, you know that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, what does that make you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (heading outside) I need some air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, by the way, some intern from your office stopped by earlier today with something. It's on the desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin walks over to the desk and picks up an envelope ma "MARTIN TANNEN". He opens it to find...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AN 8x11 PHOTO of him and Mini kissing passionately on the beach in Mexico. This time there is no question as to the nature of their relationship. Scrawled across the bottom black marker is: "REMEMBER, I'M JUST ACROSS THE FENCE".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin's eyes scan the photo, a look of resignation setti in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin slowly holds it up for her to see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, my god.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very evenly) I think it's time I had a little chat with our neighbor

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, this is exactly what he wants! What if he's working with Garson?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then he can't blackmail me. Wait here, I'll be right back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin heads for the back door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, please, don't do this! Let me go with you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said wait here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mini jumps up and runs over to him, grabbing his wrist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't do this, we can leave tonight! We'll drive to Mexico!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin looks up at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll never leave us alone, you realize that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! Let me talk to him, he promised me he wouldn't hurt us!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He did? When?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few days ago!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You saw him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I went to try and find out what he knew! I spent the afternoon with him-      M

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You...spen-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was doing it for us! I figured he wouldn't turn us in if I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I made him think I was... interested.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A wave of nausea washes over Martin's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And was he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mini nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please tell me you didn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mini hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin looks unconvinced.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just made him think I would, so he wouldn't turn us in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When Animals Attack comes on the TV in the background.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sarcastically) Thank you, I appreciate your restraint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you. I'd think you'd be a little more appreciative.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who were you doing it for when you did it with that kid? Huh? Who was that selfless act for!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, like you're such a martyr for being faithful? It shows amazing restraint to limit yourself to just one stepdaughter!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't lecture me about fidelity! Your mother was cheating within six months of the "I do's"!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He heads for the door again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, if you'll excuse me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mini grabs him again, desperate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please-- Look, I'm sorry, I really am, but this isn't the answer!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin grabs her wrist, forcefully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're hurting me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (through his teeth) Calm down or I'll snap it in two, do you hear me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mini nods her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, I want you to wait here for me. Do you understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mini nods again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly) Please don't do this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lets go and calmly walks towards the sliding doors to back yard. Mini watches him go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin stands outside and rings the bell. The door opens Rudell stands there in a smoking jacket and pajamas. He l Martin up and down with a self-satisfied smile, as Sinatr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Nice and Easy" is playing on his stereo in the backgroun

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin, what a surprise, how are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just watched Mini on your show.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahh...was tonight the night? We taped that two weeks ago. Let me tell you, I have girls audition all the time for me and... (enjoying this) She was fucking incredible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudell watches Martin's eyes for a reaction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A natural, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like a duck to water...and totally willing to take direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin's jaw tightens, as Rudell is loving twisting the k in him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish all the girls I worked with had her...how can I put this?... Need to please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You son of a bitch...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin explodes, punching Rudell in the mouth, sending hi staggering backwards inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Let's take it nice and easy..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mini stands at the window, nervously waiting on the phone She looks out THE WINDOW at the fight beginning in Rudell house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (frantic) Yes, hello, you've got to send a police car to 2376 Mira Loma Lane right away! My father's gone crazy, I think he's going to hurt our neighbor...yes 2376 Mira Loma, oh god, hurry!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudell struggles to his feet and charges Martin, shoving against his wet bar. Rudell grabs a glass and smashes it over Martin's face, grinding the glass into his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Hey, baby, what's your hurry? Relax, don't you worry..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin screams in agony and throws Rudell off him. Rudell crashes into a glass coffee table, smashing it to pieces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin tries to pick the glass out of his eyes, as Rudell gets to his feet and grabs one of metal legs of the shatt coffee table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He rushes Martin, clubbing him in the head with it. Marti crumples to the floor and Rudell starts kicking him. Mart grabs Rudell by the ankles and flips him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two men grapple on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are they?! Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talk-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't fuck with me! The negatives!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudell and Martin crash through the plate glass window on the brick patio. Martin gets to his feet first and grabs golf club propped up on a chair next to the putting green

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "The problem now of course is, to simply hold your horses..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudell struggles to his feet, just in time to see the pitching wedge heading straight for his ribs. THWACK! Mar catches him square and he goes down like a sack of potato Martin starts hitting him with one swing after another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "To rush would be a crime..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudell cries out in agony, as the blows smash one rib aft another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You son of a bitch! How's that feel?! You like that?! You thought you could have my wife and my daughter too?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "`Cause nice and easy does it, nice and easy does it..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin bends down and grabs Rudell's hair, twisting his h around so he can look him in the eye. In the distance a S is heard getting closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, pal, she's mine! Diane may have taken pity on you between vodkas, but not her! Not her!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin smashes his face into the patio. Rudell lets out a moan, grasping at the ground, trying to get up, but his l don't obey him. Martin stands up and grabs the club, rais it with both hands above his head for a final swing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now tell me where they are or I swear to god, I'll crack your head open!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin, don't!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns around to see Mini, tears coming down her cheeks standing ten feet away. The SIRENS suddenly stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go look for the negatives!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! This is insane!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need the negatives!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He raises the club again. Mini runs for him, grabbing his before it comes down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're gonna kill him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tries to pull the club away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing! He'll tell everyone!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freeze, police!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin turns around to see TWO UNIFORMED OFFICERS with th guns drawn. Martin looks down at Rudell, gasping for air, face covered in blood. He looks at his own blood-soaked clothes, the reality hitting him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drop the club and put your hands up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin obeys and Mini runs into the arms of the second officer. The first one moves quickly to Martin and shoves on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank God! Thank God, you came!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mini, you called them?! How could you call them?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mini buries her face in the officer's chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's...he's crazy, I told him not to! I told him to stop!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Nice and easy does it...every time."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mini emerges from the station with her lawyer as a throng REPORTERS jostle for a photo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needless to say, my appearance on Absolutely Positive was the most sought after clip in every newsroom in town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TV VIDEO FOOTAGE OF: Mini at Martin's trial sitting in th front row.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The trial was quick. Once Mom's affair with Rudell came out, the D.A. realized he had a motive and a slam dunk.

dialogues.speaker: T
dialogues.text: HE FOREWOMAN, an elderly hispanic woman, casts a harsh ey towards Martin and then reads the verdict.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guilty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin stares straight ahead, showing no emotion as Mini behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since, Rudell was in a coma, the issue of my relationship with Martin was moot. Martin realized trying to pin anything on me would probably get him the chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin, wearing an ORANGE PRISON UNIFORM, is led into a v by a DEPUTY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At his sentencing I begged for leniency. He got off with ten for the attempted murder of Rudell and twenty to life for mom's death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mini opens the door to find reporters camped on the lawn, snapping photos. Dozens of bouquets and wreaths are piled next to the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The outpouring of support was amazing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MAILMAN hauls a bag of sympathy cards to the front door She leads him inside where he dumps them next to three ot bags full.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun is blistering hot as Mini drives Martin's Mercede convertible with the top down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin's assets were put in a trust for me and since I was eighteen, I was allowed to live by myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns down another road at a sign reading "LOMPOC STA PRISON, 5 MILES".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mini and Martin sit facing each other behind a plexiglas barrier. There are dividers between each phone to provide prisoners with a little privacy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry I forgot to bring that book you wanted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay, Myou can mail it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you okay? You look like you haven't showered in days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (disturbed) Well...uh...you have to be careful about sh-...So how's school?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (excited) You'll never guess what happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was voted valedictorian!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But don't you have to be-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The best student? I know! But the students took a vote and they said they wanted me to have it for demonstrating remarkable courage in the face of unspeakable loss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling sadly) I wonder how the real valedictorian feels?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like slitting his wrists with the sharp end of a protractor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is Rudell out of his coma yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? (taken aback) Mini, if he recovers, he may try to blackmail you with those pictures.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nonchalant) Oh...I wouldn't worry about that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But if the D.A. got those pictures, you could-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm pretty sure he won't be doing anything with them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks suddenly very worried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mini, you're not thinking of sleeping with him to keep him quiet? Because I've met people in here who could help us with him, if it comes to that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They know people on the outside we could...pay to make sure he doesn't try to take advantage of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, gosh, that's so romantic. It's like you're a real life criminal with connections and everything, but I'm a little surprised you haven't figured it out yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mini's eyes glint ever so slightly, as she examines Marti face, almost as if he's an animal at the zoo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh...wow, like I thought you were just playing along `cause I'm your only link to the outside world, but you really don't know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin furrows his brow, confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudell didn't send those pictures.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He suddenly becomes very still, as Mini's lips curl in a smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You remember, Aurelio?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin looks at her blankly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our cabana boy from Mexico?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, it hits him.   He looks almost nauseous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a sweetie, I thought I might have to fuck him, but just giving him the camera was enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His knuckles tighten around the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You...you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was pretty clear Garson wasn't gonna give up, and sooner or later he'd find enough to charge us. It just seemed ridiculous that we'd both end up suffering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martins jaw tightens as his pupils go black.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, come on, you would've done it if you thought of it first...you know I'm right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The veins start to bulge in his arm holding the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suddenly switching gears) Hey, listen, since conjugal visits are pretty much out of the question, I thought it would be cool if we tried a little prison phone sex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin stares at her, taking deep steady breaths.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They don't tap these lines, do they? (looking around) I think I might even be able to open my blouse without anyone seeing...you ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guard!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No? Are you sure? I won't be able to come back for a few weeks. (mock jealous) Wait, have you met someone in here?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guard!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why, you old dog! I knew you wouldn't be single in here for long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A PRISON GUARD appears behind Martin's stall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guard! She did it! She just admitted it! It was her idea!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess this means I could start dating around too?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't let her leave! She's guilty! Get the warden!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, that's enough!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guard moves to take the phone from him. Martin clutch it to his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bitch! You little whore!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (starting to cry) Daddy, why are you saying those things!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guard struggles to rip the phone away, but Martin hol on for dear life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna kill you! Do you hear me, you little bitch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sobbing) Daddy, stop! I love you! Don't say that! I love you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally, the guard smashes Martin with a billy club, send him sprawling on the floor. Martin screams behind the gla but cannot be heard, as the guard hog ties him and drags away by his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SENIORS in gowns sit awaiting their diplomas, as PARENTS in the audience, fanning themselves with programs. Mini stands at the dais, addressing the class.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...As many of you know, the past few months of my life have been very difficult. I don't know how I would have gotten through it without all of you. I really think it is a testament to the love in this institution, that I stand before you today, as the first straight "C" student in school history voted Valedictorian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A FEW CHEERS go up from the rowdier students.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Again, to Marvin Tepperman, the real valedictorian, he deserved this and I want to wish him a speedy recovery. I spoke to his doctors today and they say, with medication and therapy, Marvin should be able to attend Harvard this fall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A polite smattering of applause is heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While I may not have excelled in the classroom, I think my recent experiences in that bigger schoolhouse we call "life", have taught me a few lessons that I'd like to share with my fellow graduates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her classmates instinctively lean forward a little to lis

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Follow your heart and don't question it, now matter where it tells you to go. Trust me, it'll open up a world of new experiences you can't even imagine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Principal Andrews nods in approval.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But as you listen to it, don't forget your family, your parents. Don't forget they're people too, and while we may not always agree with them, remember to love them when they need love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few PARENTS look almost surprised to hear positive thin said about them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (voice breaking) And I mean really love them, don't just pay them lip service. Really do it...Whenever you can. (holding back tears)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: I know I did, and I just wish my dad could be here today, so after this speech I could just walk down into the audience and give him my love right here...in front of all of you. Thank you and good luck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mini puts her speech down, gently sobbing, as THE AUDIENC ERUPTS. PRINCIPAL ANDREWS moves quickly to console her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like I promised, no prom night highjinks, no nerds becoming popular, no Shakespeare shoved up your ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MINI'S FELLOW GRADUATES give her a standing ovation. A fe PARENTS become misty-eyed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And in case you're feeling guilty about having no one to identify with but me, relax...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MINI looks out across the crowd and a huge smile ripples across her face, as she waves to everyone in the golden sunlight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...There's a first time for everything.
